DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Description ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): (1) randomization, direct assignment based on eligibility criteria, etc. (2) "Escalating dose cohort studies" enroll subjects in successive arms, i.e., one arm is completely filled before any subjects are enrolled in the next arm. In such a study, allocation depends on which arms have been fully enrolled and which are currently open for enrollment. Note that this example assumes that the experimental unit is the subject (rather than a part of a subject or a group of subjects). The textual representation of the activity. NOTE(S): This may contain more detail than the description present in the text part of the name code

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
